feed.subtitle: SAP TechEd blog posts in SAP Community

entry.title: Top 3 reasons to attend SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
After years of digital conferences and small-scale substitutes, SAP TechEd is finally returning to the big stage again!

As someone who literally owes his career to SAP TechEd (more on that later!), I couldn't be more excited about this revival. From my first attendance as a participant to eventually taking the stage as a speaker and ultimately becoming an SAP Mentor, TechEd has been the kickstarter of my professional journey in the SAP ecosystem.

While the virtual editions of TechEd during the pandemic served their purpose, there's something magical about in-person events that even the best-produced, high-definition streaming experience cannot match or replace.

Let me share my top three reasons why you should go for the in-person attendance rather than joining SAP TechEd virtually.

1. Let's re-ignite the community

There's a certain atmosphere to it when thousands of SAP enthusiasts gather under one roof. I still remember my first TechEd as an introvert techie, anxiously navigating through crowds, business card in hand, unsure of whom to talk to. Fast forward a few years, and those initial awkward conversations have transformed into meaningful professional relationships that would shape my career trajectory.

The SAP community is more than just a professional network; for many of us, there's a 'family reunion' flavor to it every time we meet. The spontaneous conversations in hallways, the animated discussions over coffee, and the passionate debates during evening events - these are the moments when we truly connect and 'evil plans' are sketched out. These are the interactions that eventually transform an introverted techie into a more well-rounded IT professional with a global network (anyone else?)

As we emerge from years of virtual-only connections, NOW we have the opportunity to switch back to authentic human interaction. The community needs to reconnect to share common challenges, best practices, and lessons learned.

Don't miss out on this opportunity to be part of this community reunion, and let's re-ignite the community spirit.

2. Embrace Continuous Learning

We live in interesting times, and with a hat-tip to William Gibson, may I say that we all have the privilege to experience the future firsthand?!?

GenAI is fundamentally altering the art of the possible in enterprise software, and by extension, every business function and professional role. At this pivotal moment, staying on the sidelines is not an option for anyone interested in pursuing a career in the SAP ecosystem.

At TechEd Berlin, you'll be able to touch, test, and truly understand the impact of genAI innovations in a way that's impossible through virtual attendance. The hands-on labs, expert-guided sessions, and interactive workshops provide an immersive learning environment that simply can't be replicated online.

Throughout my career in the SAP ecosystem, from working on the founding team behind SAP's cloud platform (now SAP BTP) to my current role focusing on business innovation, I've witnessed how being present at these pivotal technology inflection points provides an invaluable advantage. The questions you can ask in real-time, the nuances you can observe in demonstrations, and the collaborative problem-solving that happens spontaneously - these are the moments when it truly "clicks".

3. Boost Your Career: Grow Your Network, Expand Your Horizon

When I say "I owe my career to SAP TechEd", it's not (just) because I'm a fanboy (OK, I am) or because I drank too much cool-aid; it's true. My professional journey wouldn't have been the same without TechEd. The connections I made and the visibility I gained through presenting technical sessions paved the way to roles I never imagined possible: from becoming an evangelist for SAP Cloud Platform to joining the ranks of the SAP Mentors, it's all connected to TechEd.

Being in Berlin will put you at the pulse of what's happening in the SAP ecosystem. You'll meet the people making decisions about the future of SAP technologies. You'll connect with peers facing similar challenges across industries. You'll encounter potential employers, employees, mentors, and mentees.

A casual conversation might lead to your next career move. A question during a session might identify you as a subject matter expert to someone who needs your skills. Your thoughtful contribution to a discussion might catch the attention of a community leader looking for new voices. The relationships you build and nurture at in-person events like TechEd provide a professional support system that can guide you through career transitions, technical challenges, and professional growth opportunities for years to come.

Make a career-defining choice

While the virtual TechEd experience offers valuable content accessibility, the in-person event delivers something far more profound: a transformative experience that can reshape your career trajectory and professional identity within the SAP ecosystem.

I'm looking forward to Berlin this November, ready to reconnect with old friends and make new ones. I'd love to see as many of you there as possible. Are you in?

If you're ready to go, please register now for SAP TechEd Berlin and tell/bring a friend!

For all those who already booked your trip - I'm curious:

What are your reasons, and what are you most looking forward to? Please share your thoughts!

entry.title: Get Ready for SAP TechEd 2025: Explore the Learning Zone and Join the Devtoberfest Celebration!
entry.content:
Calling all developers, learners, and SAP tech enthusiasts! As SAP TechEd in 2025 approaches, it’s the perfect time to sharpen your skills and connect with the global SAP community.

 

SAP TechEd 2025 – Learning Zone is now live

Whether you're looking to build new skills, prepare for certification, or dive into the latest SAP innovations, the Learning Zone has everything you need – and it's all available before the main event kicks off on November 4.

 

And there’s more: SAP TechEd 2025 session catalog is now available
Browse the full list of sessions (Berlin | Virtual), explore key topics, and save your favorites to build a personalized agenda for an unforgettable learning experience.

 

What’s waiting for you in the Learning Zone?

Explore 40+ interactive value journeys and solution showcases to discover the power of SAP technologies.

Upskill with 30+ free, self-paced learning journeys aligned to SAP TechEd content tracks – curated to help you master topics that matter and prepare for your SAP Certification exam.

Try out 35+ SAP demos and 30+ real-world use cases, giving you hands-on experience with the tools that drive enterprise transformation.

👉Explore learning opportunities for each SAP TechEd 2025 track:

  • SAP Business Technology Platform - General
  • Application development and automation
  • Integration
  • Data and analytics
  • Cloud applications
  • Digital transformation with cloud ERP
  • Business AI and Joule
  • Customer support and cloud lifecycle management
  • Business transformation management

Now is the time to boost your skills, prepare for your SAP TechEd experience, and become future-ready.

 

Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd returns: September 29 – October 24, 2025

We are also thrilled to announce the return of Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd – the coding-focused celebration from developers for developers.

Devtoberfest is a multi-week event packed with fun, learning, and collaboration for SAP developers around the world. From September 29 to October 24, join thousands of fellow developers in a virtual festival-like experience that combines:

Learning through building – Hands-on tutorials, technical sessions, and challenges across SAP technologies.

Flexible participation – Join when it suits your schedule and earn points for everything you complete.

Community and connection – Collaborate with other developers and celebrate your love for coding.

Devtoberfest is more than just an event – it’s a celebration of what makes us developers: coding and collaboration.

 

 

So what are you waiting for?

🌐Jump into the SAP TechEd Learning Zone

🎉Save the date for Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd in 2025

 

Start learning, building, and celebrating today – and we’ll see you at SAP TechEd 2025!

entry.title: Why I'm Attending SAP TechEd 2025 Virtually and Top Picks
entry.content:
If you are an SAP fan like me, you know that SAP TechEd is the place to be. As always, it is packed with innovation, insights, and forward-thinking sessions.  Whether you are into SAP Integration Suite wizardry, BTP magic, or just geeking out over the latest in AI, cloud, and developer tools—this is our Super Bowl. 

This year, you can build AI agents with Joule and SAP AI services, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, automate smarter with SAP’s full developer toolchain, and modernize fast using SAP Integration Suite. Plus, it’s an amazing chance to connect with the global dev community that's shaping what’s next for the SAP ecosystem.

This year, I’m attending virtually—and no, it’s not because I’m afraid of airport security or can’t find my suitcase (okay… maybe just a little). It's because SAP TechEd virtual is packed with value, zero travel hassle, and 100% flexibility.

Here’s why I'm fired up for the virtual experience:

Access to World-Class Content

From keynote deep dives to strategy talks and road maps, SAP TechEd brings cutting-edge topics to your screen—including AI, BTP, S/4HANA, and low-code/no-code development. And yes, you can pause the session to refill your coffee. Try doing that at an in-person keynote!

It is Built for Builders
Whether you’re a developer, architect, or just SAP-curious, the virtual platform is designed to help you dig deep. Personalized tracks, live chats, and digital networking—it’s all there. 

On Your Schedule
No need to block out travel days or rearrange your week. Attend sessions live or catch replays when it works for you. Your future SAP knowledge base will thank you.

Did I mention it’s FREE?
No flights, no hotels, no expenses. Just you, your device, and an all-access pass to SAP’s most important tech event of the year.

My SAP TechEd top picks

This year, I’m especially excited about sessions that show how AI is not just a buzzword—but a real accelerator for consultants, developers, and users alike. Here are my top 3 picks you won’t want to miss:

1.- ST123v | Transforming how people work with Joule technology
Explore how upcoming innovations, third-party integrations, and customization options from Joule are changing the way we interact with SAP. Get insider insights into what’s powering the new agentic AI UI—and how it’s reshaping user experiences. AI is no longer the future—it's the co-pilot of the present.

2.- AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
See what’s next for SAP Build: enhanced pro developer tools, deeper Joule integration, and improved extensibility for LoB apps. All designed to support clean core principles and boost developer productivity.

3.- ST112v | AI and the Future of Product and UX on Web and Mobile
Joule isn’t just for consultants—it’s transforming the user experience too. This session dives into how embedded AI is enhancing UX for SAP Business Suite. Whether you're designing mobile apps or web interfaces, you'll see how users are getting more relevant, more personalized, and more intuitive experiences—and how you can be part of creating them.

So if you're thinking of joining—stop thinking and just register now 👉https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html

 

See you (virtually) at TechEd! 😉

entry.title: Demo Jam @ SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore | Nov 25–26, 2025 | BIEC
entry.content:
Bring Your Ideas to Life 

The wait is over – Demo Jam is back at SAP TechEd On Tour, happening on November 25–26 in Bangalore! This is your chance to wow customers and partners in the audience, showcase your most innovative SAP-powered solution, and prove your skills in a high-energy live showdown. 

What’s SAP Demo Jam? 

Think of it as the ultimate live demo battle - no slides, no filler. Just six minutes of pure creativity and innovation, live on stage. The winner? Chosen by the audience using our applause-o-meter. 
(Need ideas? Check out the 2023 SAP DemoJam Highlights.) 

Rules 

  • Time Limit: Exactly 6 minutes - go over and the buzzer cuts you off.
  • Live Demo Only: No PPTs, no screenshots, no videos, no AI-generated entertainment -only real, working solutions.
  • Tech Focus: Must show how you used SAP BTP (incl. SAP Build, APAB, SAP Integration Suite, HANA Cloud), SAP Business Data Cloud, and/or SAP Business AI to solve a real business problem.
  • Team Size: 2 presenters on stage.

How to Submit Your Proposal 

Email TechEdonTourBangalore2025@sap.com

Subject : SAP Demo Jam - SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore 2025 

Details : 

  • Name of your demo 
  • Detailed description of your demo 
  • Business value you’re demonstrating (max 500 words) 
  • Technology used 
  • Presenter #1: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • Presenter #2: Name, Email, Company, Job profile 
  • (Optional) Link to a short demo video 

Deadline: September 22, 2025 

What Happens Next? 

  • Selection of Finalists: Six teams will be chosen by an SAP expert panel and announced on October 3rd, 2025. 
  • Complimentary Tickets: Finalist presenters get complimentary SAP TechEd On Tour Bangalore tickets (travel & expenses not included). 
  • Live Demo: On November 26, finalists take the stage-two presenters per team-to battle it outlive.

Bring your ideas. Bring your energy. Bring your innovation. 

Let’s Jam, Bangalore!

entry.title: Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
If you are traveling to Berlin, I hope you will make time to join Marla's community session.

CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation

Community Talk

Learn how to deploy Hugging Face Transformers in SAP AI Core, manage them via SAP AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like SAP Fiori or SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). This session shares architecture, tips, and real-world use cases for bringing custom NLP models into AI Foundation on SAP Business Technology Platform.

SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalog

Get to know Marla:
Marla is a Senior Data and AI Development Consultant with a strong curiosity and a passion for learning. Her current areas of expertise and interest are in SAP AI, machine learning, and data analytics.  She specializes in integrating AI capabilities into SAP systems, creating innovative and practical solutions for real-world enterprises needs.

Hobbies & Interests:
Outside of work, Marla likes to stay active and do some sport, learning languages (currently French), and spend time with her little puppy Carlo. 

Marla and Carlo

Why Attend Marla's Session:
At SAP TechEd, Marla will be presenting a session on leveraging Hugging Face Transformers in the SAP AI Foundation. She’ll explore how to bring cutting-edge NLP models into SAP BTP, deploy them seamlessly in SAP AI Core, manage them efficiently with AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like Fiori or CAP , Along the way, you might even pick up a few insider tips for confidently navigating Hugging Face like a pro.

I hope you make time for Marla's session.

entry.title: ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd in 2025
entry.content:
Hey Everyone!

SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on the 4th of November 2025, and preparations are now in full swing at SAP!

SAP TechEd is the leading tech conference for all developers, IT professionals, business experts, tech visionaries, innovators, and leaders eager to gain in-depth knowledge of SAP’s solutions, platforms, and technologies, along with insights into their future direction. It also offer an opportunity to network and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

In 2025, SAP TechEd goes hybrid, kicking off with parallel events in Berlin, Louisville, and online – followed by SAP TechEd on Tour stops in Australia, India, UK, and Germany for a unique opportunity for an in-depth, in-person learning experience. Except for the Berlin and Bangalore stops, the on-site events are organized in partnership with, and hosted by, SAP User Groups and SAPinsider. 

The choice is yours: join us on-site in Berlin or Louisville (at ASUG Tech Connect), or online for the first events in the series! 

Save the date and register now!
📅November 4 - 6, 2025
Berlin | Virtual (free of charge) | Louisville

ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd in 2025

🔧 What to Expect

ABAP continues to evolve, and SAP TechEd events in 2025 are the best place to see what’s next. Beyond the integration of ABAP Cloud into SAP Build announced last year, and the integration of SAP Joule for Developers into the ABAP development tools along with the ABAP AI SK to infuse AI into your business processes earlier this year,  you’ll have the opportunity to explore the latest innovations and updates in ABAP Cloud, AI-based custom code transformation, clean core practices, and the new clean core levels approach for SAP S/4HANA extensibility in both the private cloud and on-premise.

💡 Why Attending ABAP Sessions Matters

  • Get a clear direction for your ABAP strategy, whether you're on ECC, S/4HANA, or SAP BTP
  • Learn how to modernize custom development without touching the core
  • See how SAP Joule for Developers, ABAP AI capabilities can support faster, cleaner development
  • Take home practical skills for RAP, testing, ABAP Test Cockpit, governance, and more

Access the SAP TechEd 2025 session catalogs:  SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual | ASUG Tech Connect.

ABAP Cloud Sessions at SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 

📅 Event Info: 

  • Dates: November 4–6, 2025
  • Location: Messe Berlin (Berlin, Germany)
  • Session formats: Strategy talks, roadmap updates, deep dives, community talks, and hands-on workshops
  • 9 Content tracks: ABAP sessions primarily in the tracks "Application Development & Automation (AD)" and "Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP (DT)" 

🎤Keynote

KEY100 | Beyond the hype: How SAP is supercharging developers for what's next
Some experts argue there’s a developer shortage. Others will say developers are no longer needed due to AI. Let’s get real: developers, architects, and technologists are here to stay, and their roles are more important than ever. Explore how the latest technology, tools, AI, agents, and learning from SAP can help you adapt these changing roles. 

🎯Strategy Talks (25 minutes)

ST109 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud Strategy | also available virtually as ST119v
The ABAP Cloud strategy as part of SAP Build and the SAP strategy go hand-in-hand. Explore in this session what this means for our major topics ABAP AI and Custom Code Transformation and how we integrate Business Data Cloud. Furthermore, learn about the ABAP IDE strategy and how we support the sovereign cloud.
Speakers: Sonja Liénard (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

ST113 – Journey to unified extensibility in SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore the strategy for extensibility across SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Learn why AI-driven development with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud is key, and how the planned harmonization will make it easier to build extensions and support the clean core. Furthermore, learn about opportunities for partners to extend SAP solutions.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Khaled Musilhy (SAP), tbd

🗺️ Roadmap Sessions (25 minutes)

AD808 – SAP Build: ABAP Cloud road map
See our upcoming innovations for the ABAP Cloud development model including Joule and the Business Data Cloud integration in context and get updates on the roadmap ahead.
Speakers: Boris Gebhardt (SAP)

DT814 – Extensibility innovations road map for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP
Explore upcoming extensibility innovations for SAP Business Suite and cloud ERP. Discover road maps for suite extensibility, harmonization, and partner enablement for commercial use cases. Learn more about upcoming innovations for AI-driven extensibility with the SAP Build solution including ABAP Cloud to support your clean core strategy.
Speakers: Oren Shatil (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), External Speaker

🔍Deep Dives (45 minutes)

AD104 – Boost your  ABAP development with Joule for developers  | also available virtually as AD104v
In this deep dive session you will learn all aspects of the ABAP AI strategy, from accelerating your ABAP development, over developing custom AI scenarios, up to using Joule to transform your ABAP code.
Speakers: Simona Marincei (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP)

AD105 – Introduction to ABAP Cloud and how to get started 
ABAP Cloud is the new way of developing ABAP—fully cloud-enabled and driven by AI. It combines cloud technologies with a clear separation of SAP and custom code, and in this way revolutionizes ABAP development. Grasp the major concepts of ABAP Cloud and learn how you can upskill. Also learn about Bosch Digital’s journey to ABAP Cloud and clean core.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Ajay Kulkarni (Robert Bosch GmbH)

AD201 – Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build - what's in for ABAP developers?   
In this deep dive we will highlight the importance of our strategic approach of integrating ABAP Cloud in SAP Build. Learn how you can benefit from this for Fiori App development and how the graphical modeler helps you to create ABAP CDS models conveniently. Finally, get insights into the future direction.
Speakers: Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

DT200 – Unravel the mysteries of Clean Core extensions in Cloud ERP Private 
Learn about the new, enhanced clean core extensibility concept in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

Learn about tools like ABAP Test Cockpit and RISE Dashboard, as well as guidance and best practices that help you to measure, govern, re-factor and develop your custom extensions in a clean core compliant, upgrade stable and cloud-ready way.
Speakers: Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT201 – Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
Learn about the on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. See how you can extend standard SAP applications and manage your custom apps directly in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Get insights into latest innovations for transactional, analytical, and integration use cases, such as the extensibility AI Assistant, editable tree-views, custom queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, ABAP SQL services and more.
Speakers: Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Oren Shatil (SAP)

🛠️ Hands-On Workshops (2 hours)

AD162 – Explore Joule for developers, ABAP AI capabilities    
Learn how to develop a RAP business object while exploring Joule's ABAP AI capabilities
Speakers: Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Dr. Anne Keller (SAP), Simona Marincei (SAP)

AD163 – Fusion Development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build
In this session we will practice fusion development of ABAP Cloud in SAP Build by creating an ABAP Cloud project from the SAP Build lobby to develop a RAP BO including a Fiori application on top.
Speakers: Ingo Braüninger (SAP), Sebastian Baskovich (SAP), Anne Keller (SAP), Katja Zoch (SAP)

AD164 – Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers    
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Join us to learn how similar development works with ABAP Cloud development model using the ABAP RESTful application programming model (RAP). ABAP Cloud is the comprehensive model for building cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default – on SAP BTP and SAP S/4HANA, both in the cloud and on-premise.
Speakers: Volker Drees (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Boris Gebhardt (SAP), Jürgen Reidl (SAP)

DT260 – Modernize classic extensions to clean core in Cloud ERP Private    
In this session you will practice a clean core extensibility in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition. You will learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP Test Cockpit, and how to use ABAP Cloud and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Olga Dolinskaja (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP), Markus Goebel (SAP)

DT261 – Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in Cloud ERP Public
Join us to discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You will learn how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch. Get practical insights through exercises and take the opportunity to ask your questions.
Speakers: Ingo Bräuninger (SAP), Carine Tchoutouo Djomo (SAP), Volker Drees (SAP), Steffen Mattes (SAP)

DT266 – Troubleshoot and Optimize ABAP Cloud Extensions in Cloud ERP 
Ensuring optimal performance and stability of your ABAP Cloud-based extensions is crucial to long-term success. Learn advanced techniques and best practices for troubleshooting and optimizing custom code in the Cloud ERP. Use powerful tools like ABAP Cross Trace to get deep insights into execution flows and resource consumption.
Speakers: Steffen Mattes (SAP), Juergen Reidl (SAP), Thomas Alexander Ritter (SAP), Thomas Fiedler (SAP)

👋Join Us

I hope this overview gives you even more reasons to join us at one of the SAP TechEd 2025 tour stops in Berlin (DE), Louisville (US), Sydney (AU), Bangalore (IN), Birmingham (UK), or Hamburg (DE) – or attend online, free of charge!

We look forward to meeting and interacting with you! 🤝  In the meantime, you can watch the replays of last year's events: ABAP Cloud at SAP TechEd Virtual 2024 and ABAP Cloud at SAP's Devtoberfest in 2024. You can also have a look at the 🔥ABAP Cloud sessions at the upcoming Devtoberfest 2025, running online and free of charge from September 29 to October 24, 2025! 🤝

Stay tuned – and see you there!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: 👟 Slip On, Speed Up: The Next Decade of Business
entry.content:
The world is in sprint mode ...

.... AI cycles flip every quarter, supply chains get bendy, climate shocks rewrite plans. As Lenin put it, "there are weeks when decades happen." Winning 2030 isn’t about hoarding data or demo sparkle. It’s about cutting friction, staying focused, and moving as one.

SAP’s 2030 play:

  • AI that removes grind - copilots, automation, anomaly detection.
  • Data you can trust - clean, connected, decision-ready.
  • Networks that sync the ecosystem - suppliers, partners, customers moving together

The metaphor? Lock laces. Triathletes don’t stop to tie shoes. They slip on and go. In finance, AI is the lock lace: auto-recs, instant cleanup, fewer errors. Hours back. Focus up. Strategy on.

This is the shift: from tying shoes to breaking records. From reconciling ledgers to reshaping the business.

Join Paul Saunders and Laura Marwood Ph.D. at SAP TechEd 2025 to see how we’re building for that future - because in 2030, every second (and every decision) will count.
__________________________________

Can't make it to Berlin? Dial in for SAP TechEd Virtual!

If you can’t make it to Berlin, we’ve still got you covered. SAP TechEd Virtual is a free online event that’ll help you broaden your technical expertise and explore SAP’s latest innovations

entry.title: Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd
entry.content:
Integration Modernization goes SAP TechEd

SAP TechEd 2025 will take place from November 4–6 in Berlin and online, offering developers and IT professionals deep insights into SAP AI, the Business Data Cloud, and the Integration Suite through hands-on labs, expert sessions, and networking opportunities.

Integration Modernization will be part of the SAP TechEd event.

Several Deep Dive Sessions and Hands-On Workshops are planned in collaboration with Product Management and an international team. In addition, our experts will be available at two information booths for direct exchange and networking.

Information booths (all day):

  • Move to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite - (Accelerate your digital transformation by moving to the cloud with SAP Integration Suite and PI Migration Assessment)
  • Integrated, innovate, and modernize with SAP Integration Suite - (Get a general overview and explore use cases, demos, and best practices for SAP Integration Suite)

Deep Dive Session (approx. 45 min):

  • Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite - (Start with a deep dive into migrating from SAP PI/PO to SAP Integration Suite by exploring tools, Edge Integration Cell, best practices, and key challenges to ensure a smooth cloud transition.)
  • Run integration scenarios in private landscapes with Edge Integration Cell - (Edge Integration Cell—SAP Integration Suite’s next-generation hybrid runtime that lets you manage APIs and run integrations securely in your private cloud or on-premise landscape.)

Hands-On Workshops (approx. 120 min.) :

  • Central monitoring of integration scenarios with the SAP Cloud ALM solution - (Gain full visibility into your integration landscape with centralized monitoring powered by SAP Cloud ALM)
  • Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite - (Ensure reliable message sequencing by implementing exactly-once in-order delivery with SAP Integration Suite)
  • Modernize and transform your integration to the cloud - (Explore the SAP Integration Suite’s Migration Assessment and Cloud Integration tooling hands-on, including its newly introduced pipeline feature, which enhances integration efficiency and scalability.
  • Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh - (Gain hands-on experience with SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh, starting with queues and topics, then explore filtering and event replay to build dynamic, event-driven scenarios.)

Join the experience: Onsite — or can't make it to Berlin? Go Virtual !

SAP Integration Suite is redefining enterprise integration by breaking down silos and connecting diverse systems across the business. Whether you're managing an SAP-centric landscape or a hybrid IT environment, its 360-degree Suite approach offers a comprehensive toolset for end-to-end integration and drives business innovation.

We’d love to hear your thoughts and experiences with SAP Integration Suite. What challenges are you facing? How can we help you unlock the full potential of your IT ecosystem? Feel free to connect on TechEd or reach out to us via SAP Integration Services.

#Modernize #Integrate #Innovate – SAP Integration Modernization TEAM

entry.title: Put your thinking cap on! It’s time to make some tough choices…
entry.content:
Ok friends, it’s the moment you’ve been waiting for. The SAP TechEd agenda builder is now LIVE. Do you know what that means?! It means that you can now create your own personalized agenda for our 3-day extravaganza – including booking the highly-coveted Hands-On Workshops in Berlin! (Trust me – they’re a kind of a big deal!)

Remember: you need a Full Conference Pass to book Hands-On Workshops and there is a maximum of 2 allowed per attendee. Act now and book your favorites! They fill up FAST!

Building your agenda is really quite simple…

Just find the session you want to attend, choose Add to Schedule and that's it!

The hard part will be deciding which sessions are “the ones” that earn precious time during your TechEd event experience.

Let’s do a quick recap of exactly what’s available in Berlin:

Strategy Talks: 25’ overview of main strategic initiatives that any SAP enthusiast needs to know. These sessions include insights from SAP leaders and often feature customers and partners who share their experiences and outlook towards innovation and transformation.

My pick: ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools

Road Maps: Any good developer knows that they need to stay up on the latest and greatest innovations in order to do their job well. Join these 25’ sessions to learn what has been recently delivered by SAP and what’s planned for the next several quarters.

My pick: AI822 | Road map: What’s planned for Joule

Deep Dives: 45’ lecture-style sessions designed to broaden your knowledge and give you concrete, tangible insights you can take back to your SAP development and implementation projects.

My pick: IN100 | Make your enterprise future ready with SAP Integration Suite

Hands-On Workshops: “Learn by doing” in these guided 2-hour, exercise-based sessions where our SAP experts have created the perfect “environment” for you to explore, learn and enhance your skills.

My pick: AD164 | Get started with ABAP Cloud for classic ABAP developers

Community Talks: Tired of listening to SAP talk about SAP? Don’t worry, it happens to the best of us. 😉 Join one of the Community Talks at the Community Clubhouse and learn what your peers are up to.

My pick: CT1249 | Real-life clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private: Keep it clean, extend smart

I know…that’s A LOT to choose from. That’s why I said…put your thinking caps on. 😉

Not to make it even more difficult for you, but I would be doing the community a disservice if I did not mention some of our “drop-in activities.”

Community Clubhouse: This is not only where you’ll find the Community Theater, but also the Developer Garage and Developer and Community Advocates like @RichHeilman, @thomas_jung, @josh_bentley, @qmacro  and more... Stop by the Clubhouse, join a Community Talk, try out a tutorial, chat with SAP Mentors & Champions, meet the Developer Advocates and start building connections that’ll last longer than SAP brand names. 😉

Demo Stations: Seeing is believing, which is why we have an amazing selection of demos across our 9 different tracks that will leave you with no other choice than to say “Yes, I believe.”

If you are not joining us in Berlin, you’ll still be able to build an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual! Be sure to leave some time in your busy calendar to get the latest and greatest insights coming to you directly from Berlin. With a curated selection of Strategy Talks, Road Maps and Deep Dives, you’ll be in-the-know from the comfort of your own home or office.

As a special treat, we’ll have some live segments exclusively for you, our virtual audience! I won’t share any details yet…but if you tune into TechEd Virtual outside of the scheduled sessions, it will be worth your while, I promise.

I haven’t mentioned the keynotes, opening or closing sessions… because those are no-brainers. Don’t worry about adding them to your schedule, we’ve done that for you already. 😉

Happy scheduling! See you in Berlin or online!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Elevate your learning, certification, and community experience
entry.content:
SAP TechEd (November 4–6, 2025) is just around the corner, bringing the SAP Community together for three days of learning and exchange. As a registered attendee, you’ll have the chance to access a 25% discount on SAP Certification with two exam attempts — a great opportunity to continue building your skills and showcase your expertise. 

Beyond certification, there are even more ways to get involved early. From community celebrations to hands-on learning and exclusive attendee benefits, SAP TechEd in 2025 offers multiple paths to build skills and connect with peers. 

Here are four highlights you won’t want to miss:  

Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd: September 29 – October 24, 2025 

Kicking things off is Devtoberfest, a multi-week, developer-focused celebration leading up to SAP TechEd. Running from September 29 to October 24, Devtoberfest is an opportunity to learn, connect, and celebrate coding with the global developer community.  

Expect tutorials, challenges, and technical sessions designed to help you sharpen your skills. Participation is flexible, and every activity you complete earns points as part of the experience. It’s an engaging way to connect with fellow developers while exploring the latest SAP technologies.  

Devtoberfest also includes a contest with a grand prize: winners from past years have joined retreats and exclusive SAP TechEd experiences, and last year’s winners will be with us in Berlin. The tradition continues in 2025, with the grand prize leading to a special retreat at a future SAP TechEd event in 2026.

Discover Devtoberfest by SAP TechEd.  

Explore the Learning Zone  

 

Why wait until November to start building new skills? The learning zone for SAP TechEd is open now, packed with resources to help you get a jumpstart on your learning journey. 

Dive in to take advantage of: 

  • Over 40+ interactive value journeys and solution showcases.  
  • More than 30+ free, self-paced learning journeys aligned to SAP TechEd content tracks.  
  • Dozens of demos and real-world use cases offering hands-on experience.  

Whether you’re looking to prepare for certification, deepen your knowledge, or explore new technologies, the learning zone provides a head start.  

Explore the learning zone today to get started on your SAP TechEd journey.  

Certification Benefits for Attendees  

SAP TechEd in 2025 also brings valuable opportunities to earn your SAP Certification.  

  • Exclusive 25% Discount: All registered attendees, whether joining virtually or onsite, will receive a 25% discount on SAP Certification. This discount applies to the two exam attempts booking and supports all participants on their path towards success. 
  • Free SAP Certification at SAP TechEd in Berlin: On the final event day, in-person attendees have the chance to take a free certification exam on site.

Learn more and register now. 

These benefits make it easier than ever to validate your skills and showcase your expertise. 

Get Ready for SAP TechEd in 2025  

By joining Devtoberfest, exploring the learning zone, and taking advantage of certification offers, you can make the most of your SAP TechEd experience before the event even begins. 

This year, SAP TechEd 2025 is back as a hybrid experience—join us in Berlin or connect online for learning and networking opportunities. Register here for the experience that suits you best!

We’re also bringing SAP TechEd on Tour to three additional cities:

  • Louisville
  • Sydney
  • Bangalore

Don’t miss your chance to be part of the global SAP community—virtually or on site—and immerse yourself in learning, collaboration, and inspiration.

entry.title: SAP Developer News September 11th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

Podcast: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/09/11/sap-developer-news-september-11th-2025/ 

CAP August 2025 release 

  • Release notes https://cap.cloud.sap/docs/releases/aug25  

ABAP AI - Chapter 2 

  • Blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/abap-ai-chapter-2/ba-p/14210568 

SAP Business Data Cloud Series 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Series – Part 3: Customer-Managed Data Products: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-business-data-cloud-series-part-3-customer-managed-data-products/ba-p/14195545 
  • SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud – a Typical Machine Learning Workflow: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-databricks-in-sap-business-data-cloud-a-typical-machine-learning/ba-p/14206612 
  • Data and AI at Devtoberfest: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest/eb-p/devtoberfest-events/label-name/data%20analytics%20ai  

Devtoberfest 2025 

  • Devtoberfest 2025: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817 

SAP TechEd Agenda Builder 

  • Ceci’s blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/put-your-thinking-cap-on-it-s-time-to-make-some-tough-choices/ba-p/14211727 
  • SAP TechEd Session Catalog and Agenda Builder: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog 
  • SAP TechEd Berlin: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin.html 
  • SAP TechEd Virtual: https://www.sap.com/events/teched/virtual.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro
0:10 CAP Aug 2025 Release
6:04 ABAP AI - Chapter 2
7:25 SAP Business Data Cloud Series
8:40 SAP TechEd Agenda Builder
9:55 Devtoberfest 2025

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for September 11th, 2025.

[DJ] In case you missed it, the August 2025 release of CAP has landed with myriad updates. Now, this is going to be a slightly longer news item than usual, so grab a cup of tea and settle in. So, front and center for us all is the brand new cap≽ire organization on GitHub, which contains a reorganized set of repos, including individual sample repos, plus the cap≽ire documentation source repo itself, where contributions are welcome. Along with this reorganization comes continuous content deployments and a setup of package publication, which is great, not least for package reuse. And this cap≽ire organization is also the new home for discussions all around Cap. Check it out. So now in the new and recently GA, generally available topic, we can see that the previously beta-only support for persistent Fiori draft messages has now graduated and become GA. Also, there's a new MCP server for Cap that can provide AI-powered development help. Talking of GA in the language and compiler topic you may remember the introduction of support for expressions as first class annotation values well that support is also now GA. Staying in the language and compiler topic the query compiler has a new optimization for path expressions involving managed to one associations. A foreign key path expression is now translated to the local foreign key column instead of the joined remote one in the Node.js runtime this is now default and you can turn it on with a switch in the Java runtime. Now in a related update you can now collapse foreign key path expressions for managed to one associations into something simpler and let auto-coercion resolve this view into the more specific single foreign key specification like this example shown in a where clause. Now moving to the Node.js and Java runtimes there are plenty of updates too. Let's start with Node.js. There's a feature that was first introduced in the Java runtime back in April this year. This has also now been made available in Node.js. It's how elements that are annotated with common.txt are automatically included when a dollar search request is processed. Great stuff. There's also now a new database service level feature that allows you to stream query results direct from the persistence layer to the HTTP response, bypassing any need to materialize the result set in memory. There are also new features relating to requiring and connecting to remote services, a new utility method for working with linked definitions, and a new container for authentication-related information. And that's cdsuser.authinfo. This replaces the now deprecated cdsuser.tokeninfo. Moving to the Java runtime, there are quality of life, quality of dev life improvements when working with query results. For typed queries the results are automatically typed and you don't need to provide the access interface anymore if you're using the single list of or stream of methods. Now for single tenant applications, this is staying in a Java runtime right now, the feature attachment plugin now supports in an alpha version the SAP BTP object store and now you'll need a service binding to an object store backend. AWS's S3, Azure's blob storage, and Google's cloud storage are all supported. Now you may already know of CDS generate, part of the CDS Maven plugin, which automatically generates access interfaces for all structured CDS model types. This feature has been evolving and the team recommends you do use this as it brings benefits and in turn allows better compile time checking. Now, there's lots of detailed documentation on this, just waiting for your reading pleasure in cap≽ire, so go and check it out. Last but not least, there's now a convenience URL that you can directly select from the console log output, and it'll take you directly to the server's index page. Nice. Moving on to the tools area, the CDS plugin for IntelliJ is now at 2.0.0, and is now fully compatible with the free community edition of IntelliJ, which means that anyone and everyone can use IntelliJ for CAP development. The new 2.0.0 version brings lots of IDE features, lots of new features for the IDE, enhanced LSP integration and new options in the settings page. And there are also in the tools topic, new ESLint checks for JavaScript, making your life as a developer easier and the life of your code smoother. There are five safety checks so far, take a look in the cds lint section of cap hire. And last but certainly not least in this release there's been some awesome work in the area of GitHub actions, a new guide, sample workflows and lots more to help you manage test, deploy, package and release your CAP projects. Now that is cool. All this and more in the August 2025 release section of the CapHire documentation. Thanks, CapTeam.

 [Mamikee] Big news for ABAP developers. ABAP AI just keeps growing. Back in February, we announced that Joule speaks ABAP. Since then, there has been a wave of new AI-driven skills. Now, you can generate wrap business objects from the database table all the way to the UI service. You can create unit tests, explain code, complete code directly in the editor, and even implement validation and determination. These capabilities are already live in the SAP VTP ABAP environment and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. And they're coming to S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition in the 2025 release. Even better, ABAP AI remains free of charge. The free promotions we introduced earlier this year have been extended until further notice. And here is another big step forward. ABAP AI will also become available for older S/4HANA private releases. Think of an AI service running side-by-side with their ABAP instance. That means you can benefit from the latest innovations without waiting for an upgrade. Want the full details? You can stay tuned for TechEd 2025. And if you want to read more on these release updates, the link is in the description below.

[Witalij] SAP Business Data Cloud, BDC, brings a data product-centric approach to managing business data. Each data product is a curated, semantically enriched package of business process data, harmonized and replicated from systems like SAP S/4HANA. For solution developers and architects among here, BDC offers a standardized platform to build, extend, and consume these data products, exposing them through APIs or events for integration with both SAP and third-party applications. To dive deeper, check out the SAP Business Data Cloud blog series, including the latest post on customer-managed data products. You'll see how to build a custom data product in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition using a custom CDS entity. There is also a dedicated series that walks through consuming data products in SAP Databricks for machine learning workflows and exposing them for inference. You'll find links to all these resources in the description. And as the Devtoberfest approaches, be sure to catch the sessions featuring product managers and the CTO of SAP Business Data Cloud.

[Daniel] SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin has just released the Agenda Builder, so you can now set your schedule for the event. Just scroll through all of the sessions, 250 keynotes, hands-on workshops, community talks, strategy talks, roadmaps and more. Select the ones that you like, click add to schedule and you're set to go. They are added to your dashboard. What's really great is that the sessions you would dream of missing are already in your schedule, like Key101, the Developer Keynote, run by a bunch of developer advocates you may recognize. If you're in Berlin, please drop by and say hello. If you can't make it to Berlin, you can still create an agenda for SAP TechEd Virtual, and the same Key101 Developer Keynote will be automatically added to your schedule. I love playing with the theme.

[Michelle]  Howdy y'all, everyone's favorite fall tech fest is just about to start. Devtoberfest 2025 kicks off on September 29th, which is only a few weeks away. Each day spotlights a different theme: ABAP, frontend tooling, AI, and more. As in years past, it's free and fully online, so jump in, earn points on the scoreboard, chase nirvana and put yourself in the running for the grand prize, which this year is a retreat to a future TechEd event and meet us developer advocates in person. Check out the post linked below for more info on the great sessions we've got coming up and the contest to see how you can win that fantastic grand prize. We hope you're just as excited to participate as we are to go live, and as always, happy coding!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Check out the Cloud ERP Track!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd goes Hybrid

Join us in person at SAP TechEd Berlin on November 4-6, 2025 or online at SAP TechEd Virtual on November 4-6, 2025 to connect with SAP experts, broaden your technical expertise and to explore the latest innovations in application development.  

 

  What is in for me in the Cloud ERP Track?

In the  track “Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP” you will explore how  Cloud ERP supports your digital transformation with solutions for your needs. Whether you’re adopting your first ERP or migrating from an existing one, learn how cloud ERP offers a comprehensive, modular, and extensible solution driven by built-in AI and analytics. 

This track covers a broad range of topics, including transitioning paths to SAP Business Suite with tools, services, and methodologies, extensibility both on-stack and side-by-side on SAP Business Technology Platform, clean core, architecture, AI, and many more.  

Our experts will not only talk about the latest innovations but will also showcase various demos and share best practices with you. You will also have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience.  

 

  Track stars (top sessions to keep on your radar) 

Start jour journey to Cloud ERP:

  • DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business | or virtual DT102v 
  • DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private | or virtual DT103v 
  • DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private 

Extend and continuously innovate with Cloud ERP: 

  • DT200 | Unravel the mysteries of clean core extensions in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT260 | Modernize classic extensions for clean core in SAP Cloud ERP Private 
  • DT201 | Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT261 | Build on-stack extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP 
  • DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP 

 

 Get more insights!

Want to learn more about the track Digital Transformation with Cloud ERP? Explore the SAP TechEd 2025 Berlin and SAP TechEd 2025 Virtual session catalogs and ensure your favourite track sessions are on your list. 


Save the date and register today!  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: SAP TechEd on Tour is Coming to Sydney!
entry.content:
Big news! SAP TechEd on Tour is landing in Sydney this November as part of Mastering SAP Collaborate From 12–14 November 2025, the ICC Sydney will become the ultimate hub for learning, innovation, and connecting with the SAP community.

 

 

 

 

 

Why You Can’t Miss This

This isn’t just another conference. This is where experts meet learners, tech meets business and where the #SAPCommunity comes alive.

Here’s what’s waiting for you:

  • Tracks covering everything from AI & Joule to Data & Analytics, S/4HANA Core, Security & Risk, Finance, Integration, HCM, and more.
  • Practical, hands-on learning you can use to solve business challenges
  • Networking with peers, partners, and SAP leaders who share your challenges (and solutions!)

Developers, This One’s for You

Our SAP Developer Advocates are joining us in Sydney - bringing fresh insights, live demos, and their best tips.

Don’t miss the Developer Garage. Your playground to:

  • Get hands-on with SAP BTP, AI, and App Dev
  • Learn new topics at your own pace
  • Experiment with guidance from SAP experts right beside you

This year is packed with possibilities! You can dive into building AI agents with Joule, unlock real-time insights with SAP Business Data Cloud, accelerate full-stack app development with GenAI, and modernize your integration landscape with SAP Integration Suite.

And that’s not all. SAP Mentors and SAP Champions will also be in the house, sharing their expertise, experiences, and community spirit. A perfect chance to connect with the people who inspire and guide the global SAP ecosystem.

Get the knowledge & then get certified with a 25% savings

Another great reason to be part of this event, is the 25% discount on any SAP Certification exam. Come and explore the most up-to-date official SAP TechEd knowledge and knowhow, and then put it to good use as part of your certification prep. The 25% saving offer is valid to 19 December. More details can be found here.

Be Part of It

If you are in the SAP ecosystem, this is the event. Whether you are a developer, architect, consultant, or business leader - there’s something here for you.

📅 12–14 November 2025
📍 ICC Sydney Exhibition Centre

View the agenda here.

Register here.

entry.title: Shape What’s Next with SAP Integration Suite at TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community! 🚀 SAP TechEd 2025 is almost here!
Get ready to explore how we’re shaping the future of integration. Learn how SAP Integration Suite delivers on end-to-end integration requirements, discover how we’re driving modernization for customers, and see how enterprise automation can unlock new opportunities for your business.

Don’t miss the chance to gain insights, connect with experts, and experience the innovations that will power the next generation of intelligent enterprises. Join us at SAP TechEd 2025—in Berlin or virtually!

🚨Save the date and register today:  November 4-6, 2025 SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual 

What is in SAP Integration Suite track?

SAP Integration Suite empowers developers to drive innovation with an integration platform as a service (iPaaS) on SAP Business Technology Platform, which unifies on-premises and cloud-based systems, applications, events, and data. Discover how AI-powered capabilities in SAP Integration Suite can help harmonize user experiences and improve developer productivity and operational excellence across complex and diverse IT landscapes.

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions 👇

Roadmap Sessions:

IN800 | Innovations, investments, and future road map for SAP Integration Suite

IN801 | Use SAP Process Integration and Orchestration to SAP Integration Suite

IN824 | Harnessing AI, APIs, and events for strategic integration and innovation

 

Hands-on Sessions:

IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation

IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite

IN164 | Getting started with Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

IN260 | Master integrations: Integration Advisor and Trading Partner Management

Deep Dive sessions:

Visit our booths at Berlin:

🔍Don't miss out! Explore the TechEd 2025 session catalog and ensure your favorite SAP Integration Suite track sessions are on your list. We're excited to connect with you at the upcoming TechEd sessions.

entry.title: My expert playlist, SAP TechEd, Virtual

entry.title: A day in the life of a cloud ERP implementation consultant at SAP TechEd 2025 in Berlin
entry.content:
As a cloud ERP implementation consultant, I’m always looking for ways to sharpen my skills, stay on top of innovations, and connect with peers who face the same challenges in customer projects. For me, SAP TechEd has always been the place where all of this comes together and I’m sure TechEd 2025 in Berlin will be no different.

It’s not just about listening to sessions. It’s about walking away with concrete knowledge and hands-on experience I can apply on Monday morning with my customers. Here’s how I’ve built my personal agenda for TechEd 2025.

Hopefully, it gives you some inspiration for planning your own.

 

Day 1 - Getting started with the big picture

My first day is about getting inspired, hearing the strategy, and understanding the direction of SAP’s Business Suite and cloud ERP.

  • 9:30 AM - 9:55 AM CET:
    ST108 | Stop managing complexity: Start building what really matters
  • 10:30 AM - 11:15 AM CET:
    DT102 | Choosing the right path to SAP Business Suite for your business
  • 12:30 PM - 12:55 PM CET:  
    PAR101 | Accelerate your IT transformation with process-aware agentic testing
  • 12:30 PM - 2:30 PM CET:
    DT161 | Implementation experience for SAP Cloud ERP

Day 2 - Deep Dive into daily bread and butter

Day 2 is where I get into the practical details that matter most for my projects.

  • 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET:
    DT262 | Implementation accelerators for SAP Cloud ERP
    I need to speed up here to make it to my next favorited session. 😉
  • 12:15 PM - 1:00 PM CET:
    DT100 | From onboarding to go-live with SAP Cloud ERP
  • 1:00 PM - 3:00 PM CET:
    DT264 | How to start transitioning to SAP Cloud ERP Private
  • 4:15 PM - 5:00 PM CET:
    DT103 | Guidance to ease your transition to SAP Cloud ERP Private

Day 3 - Looking ahead and staying competitive

The final day is all about exploring future trends and preparing for what’s next.

  • 9:00 AM - 9:45 AM CET:
    BTM105 | Shaping the future with integrated IT and business process management
  • 10:30 AM - 10:55 AM CET:
    DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP with SAP and Accenture
  • 12:00 PM - 12:45 PM CET:
    AI105 | Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio
  • In the afternoon, I also plan to spend time at the demo pod.
    A great chance to discuss my long list of topics with experts and get practical advice for customer projects:
    DT917 | Cloud ERP implementation and transition paths

Final thoughts

As an implementation consultant, I know the daily reality: deadlines, requirements, and the pressure to deliver. SAP TechEd 2025 helps me reset, recharge, and return with new knowledge that directly impacts my work.

If you’re an implementation consultant like me, TechEd isn’t just another event. It’s where our role gets the spotlight and where we walk away better equipped to help customers succeed.

Save the date and register today 
November 4-6, 2025 
SAP TechEd Berlin | SAP TechEd Virtual

entry.title: Call for Community Talk Speakers! Step into the Spotlight at SAP TechEd on Tour – Bangalore 2025
entry.content:
Hello SAP community enthusiasts! 

 Are you passionate about sharing your knowledge and experiences with fellow tech-savvy individuals attending SAP TechEd on Tour? Do you have innovative ideas or insights into SAP technologies that you think could benefit others? If so, here's an exciting opportunity for you to shine!  

We are offering Community Talks, which are 20-minutes session slots, to be filled by community members to share their knowledge with the community onsite at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore. Sign up as Community Talk speaker for our much-anticipated event taking place on November 25-26, 2025! 

As a Community Talk Speaker you’ll get a “Lecture-Only” ticket to attend SAP TechEd. Travel and Expenses are not covered by SAP.

Why Participate as a Community Talk Speaker? 

As a speaker at SAP TechEd, you'll be at the forefront of inspiring and engaging with technical professionals, developers, and business leaders. It's a unique opportunity to: 

  • Showcase Your Expertise: Share your unique insights, experiences, and innovations with a diverse audience. Hands-on, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  • Network and Collaborate: Connect with other SAP professionals, enthusiasts, and thought leaders from around the globe in the Community Theatre at SAP TechEd on Tour Bangalore. 
  • Expand Your Reach: Gain visibility in the SAP ecosystem and establish yourself as a go-to expert in your field. 

Topics to Consider 

We're looking for presentations on a wide range of topics that resonate with SAP TechEd's core focus areas. There are nine content tracks, please have a look at all of them on the SAP TechEd Event Website. These include (but are not limited to): 

  • Application Development and Automation 
  • Business Transformation Management 
  • AI and machine learning applications in SAP such as Business AI and Joule 
  • Breakthroughs in data management and analytics 
  • Integration 
  • Cloud Applications  

If you have a creative idea that pushes the boundaries of what's possible with SAP, we'd love to hear about it! 

Important Dates and Deadlines: 

To ensure you don't miss out, please keep an eye on the following important dates: 

  • Deadline for Speaker Applications and your Session Submissions: October 10, 2025 
  • Notification of Acceptance: October 17, 2025 
  • Final Presentation Submission for review: November 10, 2025 (if you don’t intend to have a presentation for your session, even better!) 
  • Date of the event: November 25-26, 2025 (ensure to be available on both days until the Community Talks schedule is finalized) 

How to Apply 

Think you're ready to take the stage? Here’s how you can apply: 

  1. Prepare Your Proposal: Outline the main points and objectives of your talk. Make sure it aligns with this year’s focus areas (see SAP TechEd Event Website for content tracks) and is tech-content (it should not be marketing products, services or companies).  Again, hands-on-style, demos, presentations, anything that helps your audience to learn from your session is welcome. 
  2. Submit Your Application: Write an email to us and complete the email with all session details. Use this mailto link as it is prepared with all details for your convenience.  
  3. Document Your Passion: Highlight your enthusiasm and experience with SAP solutions—include any previous speaking engagements or relevant achievements. You’re very welcome to share an abstract of your session here in community.sap.com and gain feedback and reputation as a fellow community member.  

Join us in Bangalore! 

Let's make this year's conference inspirational and groundbreaking together. We can’t wait to hear your stories, ideas, and innovations. Join us and become an integral part of the SAP Community! 

Feel free to share this opportunity with your colleagues and networks who may be interested in speaking or attending. Together, let’s continue to push the boundaries of technology and innovation. 

We look forward to seeing you at SAP TechEd on Tour in Bangalore!

entry.title: The Pragmatist’s Guide to AI: From Architectural Foundation to Real-World Value
entry.content:
Picture this: a demand forecast model trained on years of sales data looks perfect in testing, but once live, it misses a major promotion and a supply chain disruption because that data sits elsewhere. The model wasn’t wrong — it was perfectly wrong.

At SAP TechEd 2025, a joint session with Google Cloud will show how to close the Context Gap and unlock real business impact with AI. The session will explore:

  • The provocation – Casey West, Lead Developer Advocate at Google Cloud, reframes the AI challenge, introducing the Context Gap.
  • The proof in action – Laura Marwood, SAP Product Strategist for the SAP Business Suite will show a live demo on how SAP’s unified suite lets AI orchestrate seamlessly across roles and systems that turns chaos into growth
  • The architectural blueprint – Manoj Swaminathan, GM and CPO of the SAP Business Suite, Finance and Spend explains the foundation: a clean core, unified data fabric on BTP, and embedded AI by design.
  • The playbook – A practical maturity model guides teams from efficiency > productivity > true impact.

This is AI for pragmatists: closing the Context Gap with SAP’s suite-first strategy so AI doesn’t just generate output - it creates lasting business value.

👉 Don’t miss this session at SAP TechEd 2025!

https://www.sap.com/events/teched/berlin/flow/sap/te25/catalog-inperson/page/catalog/session/1749125306565001Gf8a

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025 - Go Mobile!!!
entry.content:
SAP TechEd in 2025 kicks off on November 4th in Berlin, and preparations are in full swing! This premier tech conference is perfect for developers, IT professionals, business experts, and tech visionaries to deepen their knowledge of SAP solutions and connect with peers and SAP experts. 

We have prepared an exciting offering of mobile sessions for you: Strategic Talks, Roadmap and Hands-on sessions on Mobile Apps, Mobile Design and Mobile Technology. Furthermore, we will have a demo booth where you can explore our apps an Mobile Joule on your own. 

Certainly Mobile AI, is the focus topics this year. 

Here are some of the sessions I’m most looking forward to this year:

CA200 | An overview of our AI-enhanced mobile products across SAP Business Suite - Deep Dive
View demos of selected apps and learn how the latest mobile apps from SAP make it easier for your users to leverage SAP Business Suite on the go. You can build your own mobile apps the same way we do—start by exploring how we use SAP Design System for mobile apps as well as the latest technologies such as the Joule copilot and SAP Build solutions.  

ST112 | AI and the future of product and user experience on the web and mobile - Strategy Talk
Discover how the Joule copilot and embedded AI are transforming UX as well as how you can use AI to enhance and extend the UX for SAP Business Suite. See our strategy for giving users access to all they need and enabling them to provide feedback, wherever they are, through the web and on mobile, including applications and central services.

CA811 | User and product experience innovations by SAP—on the web and mobile - Road Map
Have a look at the latest user and product experience innovations across our suite of applications, along with cool innovations coming soon—on the web and mobile. Also, check out selected highlights from UI technologies.

AD170 | Build scalable enterprise mobile solutions with SAP Build - Hands-on Workshop
Dive into the technical details of building scalable, cross-platform mobile solutions with SAP. Get a hands-on overview of integrating SAP Build solutions and our mobile development kit to streamline your development process and deliver high-quality apps.

CA260 | Learn how to build your own app and use it in SAP Mobile Start - Hands-on Workshop
Build an application on SAP BTP using SAP Build Code and SAP Cloud Application Programming Model that integrates with SAP Mobile Start. Accelerate development with development productivity tools in SAP Business Application Studio. Learn how to make the app accessible and send push notifications for relevant business events directly to your users.

CA201 | Creating AI-enhanced UX for your own applications with SAP Design System - Deep Dive
Discover how AI is changing the idea of what an application is—and what this means for you. Learn about how to create AI-enhanced UX for your applications by using SAP Design System (SAP Fiori UX for web and mobile), and see how building applications is made easier through our AI UI technologies for web and mobile apps.

AD109 | Bridging the gap: Build your enterprise mobile strategy - Deep Dive
Are your employees struggling to find critical company data on the go? The SAP Mobile Start app solves that challenge by connecting them to SAP Build Work Zone and enabling custom mobile solutions. Find out how to create a powerful, integrated mobile journey for increased productivity.

AI166 | Mobile projects with SAP Joule for Consultants and SAP Joule for Developers - Hands-on Workshop
Learn how SAP Joule for Consultants accelerates execution of mobile projects and cloud transformation by simplifying knowledge access and offering expert guidance. Also, explore SAP Joule for Developers and its mobile development kit AI capabilities—including code suggestions, explanations, test generation, and more—to boost development efficiency.

CA914 | AI-based user and product experience innovations on the web and mobile - Demo Station
Experience the latest user and product experience innovations by SAP, including the Joule copilot on mobile devices and AI-embedded scenarios. Learn how you can leverage SAP Design System and our UI technologies to build your own apps. 

Do not miss this opportunity and join us in Berlin. Register now! 📅November 4 - 6, 2025 Berlin 
We look forward to meeting and interacting with you!
